Replace.Text: Allows building camps on frozen ground. Camps on frozen ground gain +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] production, +1 [ICON_FAITH] faith, and +1 [ICON_FAITH] faith if on hills. Each camp provides a small [ICON_FOOD] food bonus to adjacent areas. [NEWLINE]When you first build a city, you will immediately receive the Great Man "Yeragond" and the Heroic Relic "Yeragond Stone". Yeragond will automatically retire after 20 [ICON_TURN] turns (at online speed). After researching "Theology", you will receive "Operator First Snow". [NEWLINE]Units will not be damaged by blizzards.
+{1_num} [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production from adjacent camp improvements

Owned [ICON_GREATWORK_RELIC] relics and heroic relics provide +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] productivity and +2 [ICON_FAITH] faith.
Enemy units in the two surrounding cells gain -2 [ICON_STRENGTH] combat strength.
Enemy units within two blocks of the first snow have -2 [ICON_STRENGTH] combat strength.
Each district in the city where an international trade route starts provides a district bonus equal to that of a domestic trade route, earning twice as many alliance points from trade routes.

Khara TradeTrade posts across Kjerag with lower production costs. Get 10% discount on units purchased with [ICON_GOLD] gold or [ICON_FAITH] Faith. Khara Trade Posts provide double the regional bonus to Trade Routes. [NEWLINE]Receive +2 [ICON_GOLD] gold from adjacent Barracks, and +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] production to Barracks.

Production costs are lower, and units are bought with [ICON_GOLD] gold or [ICON_FAITH] faith for 10% off. The Kharan Trade Post provides double the regional bonus to trade routes. [NEWLINE] Receive +2 [ICON_GOLD] gold from adjacent barracks, and provide +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] production to the barracks.

Silver-Gray unique unit that replaces the Armored Warrior. It has higher combat power and mobility, and can perform ranged attacks within a 1-tile range. +2 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Power when attacking injured units, and +1 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Power when in frozen ground.

Fragile: +2 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength when attacking injured units.

When a city is converted for the first time using a religious unit, it gains 5 [ICON_CULTURE] culture for every [ICON_CITIZEN] population it has (at online speed). When an Apostle outside the country uses up his missionary charges, he generates an [ICON_GREATWORK_RELIC] relic.

Kjerag's religious order, worshiping Yelagund. [NEWLINE]Lower regional production costs. +2 [ICON_RELIGION] missionary times for apostles recruited from Manjuin cities, and the master reduces nearby hostile units by -2 [ICON_STRENGTH] combat strength.
Lower regional production costs, +2 [ICON_RELIGION] missionary times for Apostles recruited by Manjuin City, and -2 [ICON_STRENGTH] combat strength of nearby hostile units by the Master.
Hostile units near the Master gain -2 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength.

The place where the Holy Bell is stored in Manzhuyuan. It has two [ICON_GREATWORK_RELIC] relic slots. When the slots are filled, it will automatically be themed, but only provide a 50% themed output bonus.

Unlocked after researching "Mathematics". If in frozen ground, +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] productivity to adjacent cells, +1 [ICON_SCIENCE] technology if the city has an academy. Secondary and tertiary buildings of adjacent academies and industrial zones provide additional technology or productivity radiation to the station. [NEWLINE]Provides standard adjacency bonus to adjacent academies and industrial zones. Can only be looted by natural disasters (cannot be destroyed). [NEWLINE]+1 charm to surrounding cells. Only one can be built per city. The cell cannot be populated, and cannot be adjacent to another Kjerag station.

If in frozen ground, +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Productivity to adjacent cells, +1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science to city with a college.
